key.name: current-profile
key.description: Describes the current profile

key.name: existing-profiles
key.description: Profiles available for the GSettings backend to use

key.name: active
key.description: Whether this plugin would be activated by gnome-settings-daemon or not

key.name: priority
key.summary: Priority to use for this plugin
key.description: Priority to use for this plugin in gnome-settings-daemon startup queue

key.name: idle-brightness
key.summary: The brightness of the screen when idle
key.description: This is the laptop panel screen brightness used when the session is idle.

key.name: idle-dim
key.summary: Dim the screen after a period of inactivity
key.description: If the screen should be dimmed to save power when the computer is idle.

key.name: sleep-inactive-ac-timeout
key.summary: Sleep timeout computer when on AC
key.description: The amount of time in seconds the computer on AC power needs to be inactive before it goes to sleep. A value of 0 means never.

key.name: sleep-inactive-ac-type
key.summary: Whether to hibernate, suspend or do nothing when inactive
key.description: The type of sleeping that should be performed when the computer is inactive.

key.name: sleep-inactive-battery-timeout
key.summary: Sleep timeout computer when on battery
key.description: The amount of time in seconds the computer on battery power needs to be inactive before it goes to sleep. A value of 0 means never.

key.name: sleep-inactive-battery-type
key.summary: Whether to hibernate, suspend or do nothing when inactive
key.description: The type of sleeping that should be performed when the computer is inactive.

key.name: button-suspend
key.description: The action to take when the system suspend button is pressed.

key.name: button-hibernate
key.description: The action to take when the system hibernate button is pressed.

key.name: button-sleep
key.description: The action to take when the system sleep (non-specific type) button is pressed.

key.name: button-power
key.description: The action to take when the system power button is pressed.

key.name: lid-close-battery-action
key.summary: Laptop lid close action on battery
key.description: The action to take when the laptop lid is closed and the laptop is on battery power.

key.name: lid-close-ac-action
key.summary: Laptop lid close action when on AC
key.description: The action to take when the laptop lid is closed and the laptop is on AC power.

key.name: lid-close-suspend-with-external-monitor
key.summary: Laptop lid, when closed, will suspend even if there is an external monitor plugged in
key.description: With no external monitors plugged in, closing a laptop's lid will suspend the machine (as set by the lid-close-battery-action and lid-close-ac-action keys). By default, however, closing the lid when an external monitor is present will not suspend the machine, so that one can keep working on that monitor (e.g. for docking stations or media viewers). Set this key to False to keep the default behavior, or to True to suspend the laptop whenever the lid is closed and regardless of external monitors.

key.name: critical-battery-action
key.description: The action to take when the battery is critically low.

key.name: percentage-low
key.description: The percentage of the battery when it is considered low. Only valid when use-time-for-policy is false.

key.name: percentage-critical
key.description: The percentage of the battery when it is considered critical. Only valid when use-time-for-policy is false.

key.name: percentage-action
key.description: The percentage of the battery when the critical action is performed. Only valid when use-time-for-policy is false.

key.name: time-low
key.description: The time remaining in seconds of the battery when it is considered low. Only valid when use-time-for-policy is true.

key.name: time-critical
key.description: The time remaining in seconds of the battery when it is considered critical. Only valid when use-time-for-policy is true.

key.name: time-action
key.summary: The time remaining when action is taken
key.description: The time remaining in seconds of the battery when critical action is taken. Only valid when use-time-for-policy is true.

key.name: use-time-for-policy
key.description: If time based notifications should be used. If set to false, then the percentage change is used instead, which may fix a broken ACPI BIOS.

key.name: notify-perhaps-recall
key.summary: If we should show the recalled battery warning for a broken battery
key.description: If we should show the recalled battery warning for a broken battery. Set this to false only if you know your battery is okay.
